name: Laura Tremosa
content:
Laura Tremosa Bonavia (born 1937, Espolla, Catalonia) is a Spanish industrial engineer and feminist. She studied mechanical engineering at the Polytechnic University of Catalonia in Barcelona, and earned her doctorate in the same field at the UPC in 1964. She was the first Catalan woman, and the second Spanish woman who qualified in industrial engineering.[1][2][3][4]
 This article about a Spanish engineer, inventor or industrial designer is a stub. You can help Wikipedia by expanding it.
raw:
Spanish industrial engineer and feminist
 Laura Tremosa
Laura Tremosa Bonavia (born 1937, Espolla, Catalonia) is a Spanish industrial engineer and feminist. She studied mechanical engineering at the Polytechnic University of Catalonia in Barcelona, and earned her doctorate in the same field at the UPC in 1964. She was the first Catalan woman, and the second Spanish woman who qualified in industrial engineering.[1][2][3][4]

Selected works[edit]
La robòtica a la indústria catalana (1989)
La Mujer ante el desafío tecnológico (1986)
References[edit]


^ "Las mujeres de mi época veían la carrera muy larga" (in Spanish). El Periodico. 9 June 2012. Retrieved 11 March 2015.

^ GARCÍA GARCÍA, SONIA (16 February 2010). "Laura Tremosa: "Em pregunto si les dones hem sigut colonitzades pels homes"" (in Catalan). El Periodico. Archived from the original on 1 February 2014. Retrieved 11 March 2015.

^ Segura, Antoni (2000). Ensenyament, cultura, justícia. Edicions Universitat Barcelona. p. 159. ISBN 978-84-8338-296-7.

^ Arnal, Salvador López; López, López Arnal; Fuente, Pere de la (1 March 1996). Acerca de Manuel Sacristán Luzón. Destino. p. 748. ISBN 978-84-233-2566-5.
